1.text: A GOOD name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favor rather than silver and gold.

2.text: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.

3.text: A prudent man foresees the evil, and hides himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

4.text: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honor, and life.

5.text: Thorns and snares are in the way of the fraudulent: he that does keep his soul shall be far from them.

6.text: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

7.text: The rich rules over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

8.text: He that sows iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

9.text: He that has a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he gives of his bread to the poor.

10.text: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yes, strife and reproach shall cease.

11.text: He that loves pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

12.text: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthrows the words of the transgressor.

13.text: The slothful man said, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

14.text: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.

15.text: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

16.text: He that oppresses the poor to increase his riches, and he that gives to the rich, shall surely come to want.

17.text: Bow down your ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply your heart to my knowledge.

18.text: For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you; they shall with be fitted in your lips.

19.text: That your trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to you this day, even to you.

20.text: Have not I written to you excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

21.text: That I might make you know the certainty of the words of truth; that you might answer the words of truth to them that send to you?

22.text: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

23.text: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

24.text: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man you shall not go:

25.text: Lest you learn his ways, and get a snare to your soul.

26.text: Be not you one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

27.text: If you have nothing to pay, why should he take away your bed from under you?

28.text: Remove not the ancient landmark, which your fathers have set.

29.text: See you a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
